intro: Nyssa coccinea, commonly known as the red bay tree, is a deciduous tree native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Cornaceae and is characterized by its smooth, reddish bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, followed by orange-red berries that are an important food source for wildlife. Nyssa coccinea thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in bottomlands and along stream banks. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
